profile.name: Evan You
profile.bio: Founder @voidzero-dev, author of @vuejs & @vitejs. Building cool stuff with #GoLang. Sushi aficionado 🍣. Learning something new every day.

tweets.content: Just spent an hour debugging a production issue only to realize I had a typo in a CSS variable name. My brain needs a `git revert --hard`. 🤦‍♂️
Some days, the simplest things bring the most joy. Tonight, it's just really good toro and a quiet moment. Refueling for another week of building. 🍣 #gratitude
A perfect omakase experience is like a perfectly optimized build process: each component plays its part, leading to pure, unadulterated delight. Except less debugging. 🍣 #sushilife

Unpopular opinion: The pendulum of web development always swings. We're past peak 'JavaScript everywhere' and are now seeing a healthy return to server-side rendering + hydration for a reason. DX & perf, folks.

Working through some interesting RFCs for Vue 3.4. Community feedback has been invaluable in shaping the path forward. Keep an eye out for improved `<script setup>` ergonomics and better reactivity debugging! #vuejs

Deep dive into Bun's native FFI capabilities today. The performance gains are intriguing for certain use cases, especially connecting with system libraries. Always exciting to see new approaches. #bunjs #javascript
So much gratitude for all the open source maintainers out there. The invisible labor of documentation, bug triaging, and community support is monumental. Thank you for making the web possible. 🙏

Just saw the news about CSS `text-wrap: balance` reaching stable. This is a game-changer for typography and overall aesthetic. Excited to see how it improves the user experience across the web! Kudos to the browser teams.

Vite 5.1 is out! Major thanks to all contributors for the continuous improvements. This release includes improved HMR stability & better dev server optimizations. Keep those PRs coming! #vitejs #webdev
Early morning whiteboard session with the @voidzero_dev team sketching out the architecture for our next big feature. The energy is palpable, and the ideas are flowing! Feeling very optimistic. ✨

I firmly believe that the next significant leap in frontend performance won't come from faster JavaScript runtimes, but from a fundamental shift in how we bundle and deliver assets. Think beyond tree-shaking and client-side cascades.

Interesting read from @smashingmag on the future of web components. I agree with the emphasis on interoperability and framework agnosticism. It's crucial for long-term sustainability. [Article link implied]

Excited to announce that @voidzero_dev just closed a small seed round to accelerate our vision for next-gen developer tooling. Huge thanks to our investors and our incredible team! More updates coming soon. 🚀

Experimenting with Rust for a CLI tool today. The borrow checker is an acquired taste, but the guarantees it provides are just *chef's kiss*. Still prefer TS for web, but Rust for infra is a joy. #rustlang
Is it really 'done' if I don't comment out a `console.log` right before pushing to production? Asking for a friend. 👀 #devhumor

Spent the morning deep-diving into WebAssembly Component Model proposals for a new @voidzero_dev module. The potential for truly composable, language-agnostic primitives is immense. Mind-bending stuff. #webassembly #voidzerodev

The obsession with 'zero JS' for every single marketing page or static site misses the point. The goal should be *minimal, performant, and purposeful* JS, not necessarily zero. Pragmatism over dogmatism.
My computer's fan after `npm install` is basically a jet engine. Might as well classify it as a home appliance at this point. 💨 #devlife
